title: X Factor: Celebrity live shows line-up after judges' U-turn Jenny Ryan decision
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The X Factor: Celebrity sent fans wild after the judges told The Chase's Vixen, Jenny Ryan, that she wouldn't be in the live shows.

Fans were left crushed, especially after she belted out Queen's smash hit Somebody to Love.

But the judges had a mighty rethink, and soon enough quiz genius was told she'd be stunning the nation live.

The live shows get going this Saturday, and boast an epic, star-studded line-up, including some stiff competition for Jenny.

Judges Nicole Scherzinger , Louis Walsh and head honcho Simon Cowell have all been given categories of contestant to mentor.

The line-up is...

Groups, mentored by Simon

Max and Harvey

(Image: ITV)

Twins Max and Harvey have amassed an eye-wateringly huge social media following, after they took to social platform musical.ly with lip syncs of some of their favourite songs.

The 16 year-old Berkshire natives released their debut single, One More Day in Love in 2016, and soon after performed a cover of DJ Snake and Justin Bieber's Let me Love You in early 2017.

Last year, they signed a deal with RMI records.

V5

(Image: PA)

Social media influencers Sofia Oliveira, Alondra Martinez, Laura Buitrago, Natalie Valerin and Wendii Sarmiento form V5, Simon's five piece girl pop group.

With a combined social media following of over 11 million and over 250 million views on YouTube, the girls are at the top of their digital game.

Sofia said of her her online presence: "It's one of the most important things for my career!

"With social media I can connect with people from all over the world and they opened doors to show my talent and what I love to do!

"It's a huge responsibility, you have to be careful, but this is not a downside, just a hard thing."

Try Star

(Image: ITV)

Rugby legends Ben Foden, Levi Davis and Thom Evans form Try Star.

Ben actually rapped to Blackstreet's No Diggity during the judges' houses stage, to the astonishment of fans.

The three hunks have managed to capture the hearts of many viewers, with one gushing: "Let's be honest, who really care how well Try Star sing?"

The Islanders

(Image: PA)

These former Love Islanders from the class of 2018 are among the favourites to win, because of their millions of fans.

Eyal Booker, Samira Mighty , Wes Nelson and Zara McDermott received mixed responses from judges and fans when they performed a rendition of Shawn Mendes' Nothing Holding Me Back.

Wes, who's dating another Love Island star, Arabella Chi, particularly impressed with his rap.

The Under-28s, mentored by Louis

Jonny Labey

(Image: ITV)

26 year-old Jonny used to star in hit soap EastEnders , before his character was Paul Coker was killed off in a controversial story line about homophobia.

He's had a fair bit of experience with musical theatre, and his singing catalogue includes In The Heights by Hamilton creator Lin-Manuel Miranda.

For the judges, he performed an undeniably cool rendition of Feel It Still by Portugal, in a fantastically colourful shirt.

Kevin McHale

(Image: ITV)

Kevin starred in US show Glee as fan favourite Artie Abrams.

Nicole knows Artie from before X Factor , as his boyband NLT once opened for Nicole and her former Pussycat Doll band mates back in 2007.

It's also not the American's first experience of the UK, as he hosted E4's Virtually Famous.

Olivia Olson

(Image: ITV)

Former child star Olivia already showed off her vocals in the wildly popular rom-com Love Actually.

She performed Mariah Carey's All I Want For Christmas Is You, and the film has become a festive classic, featuring Hollywood heavy hitters such as Emma Thompson, Liam Neeson and Rowan Atkinson.

Olivia's now 27, and heading to the X Factor live shows.

Megan McKenna

(Image: ITV)

One of the favourites to win, the former Towie star has had a troubled record with fame.

She recently revealed that she's faced struggles with her self-image and alcohol, but now she's blowing the judges' socks off.

Megan has a fierce passion for country music, and some fans reckon she's got it in the bag.

The Over-28s, mentored by Nicole

Jenny Ryan

(Image: ITV)

Jenny was over the moon when she heard her X Factor experience wasn't over.

The Chase star beamed: "I've loved every moment of the X Factor and I'm delighted to be able to get the opportunity to perform live."

Mentor Nicole's just as excited to have her back: "Jenny was just brilliant at her audition in LA. That voice of hers is one of a kind, and she's an amazing person to get to know."

Victoria Ekanoye

(Image: ITV)

The 36 year-old actress is a former Coronation Street star who played Angie Appleton.

She was a fan favourite but left the show earlier this year.

Victoria boasts a role in The Royals, and proved she could sing with a part in the theatre adaptation of the Lion King in the West End.

Ricki Lake

(Image: ITV)

Ricki's had a long and hugely distinguished career, and won the judges over with her James Bay cover.

The American presenter and producer played the lead in the 1988 edition of the musical Hairspray, earning her a huge following.

She's faced serious struggles and grief though, after her ex-husband Christian Evans took his own life.

Ricki told podcast The Dan Wootton Interview : "It's a tragedy I don't think I'll ever recover from."

Martin Bashir

(Image: ITV)

Journalist Martin, 56, is the first to admit he's got no musical experience.

His rendition of Frank Sinatra's Love managed to win over the judges, though, and he's developed a cult following among the fans.

He's famous for a string of high-profile celebrity interview, including with Michael Jackson for a 2003 documentary.

Vinnie Jones

(Image: ITV)

Fans were overjoyed to hear football and acting legend Vinnie would be taking part, but he didn't appear in the auditions due to the sad passing of his wife, Tanya.

Tanya passed away from cancer around the time of filming.

Still, Vinnie will be in the live shows after agreeing to it while on a phone call with Simon.

When Simon asked how he was, Vinnie replied: "Yeah my daughter is fantastic, she's been strong, it's really brought us closer together.

"We are just getting through it, you learn just to carry the grief really Simon."

When asked about the live shows, he said: "Well Tan's pushed me really Simon, we knew it was all going on and I put it to the family and Tan was very excited about it.

"I'd love to, if you'd have us there. I'm with you, I trust you, I'm up for that."

"Huge respect, Vinnie," Simon said, "I can't wait to see you."
description: It's shaping up to be a tough competition after The Chase's Jenny Ryan was saved by the judges after initially being told she hadn't made it to the live shows
